reuze

Class ib_FilterFloodFill

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuze.ib_FilterFloodFill

  • public final class ib_FilterFloodFill
extends java.lang.Object
    Drawing class which provides flood fill functionality. Found on http://www.javagaming.org forum and adapted to be more generic. Anti-aliasing and texture filling capability added.
    Since:
    April 26, 2005
    Author:
    kingaschi (Christph Aschwanden - king@kingx.com), moogie (Javagaming Forum), tom (Javagaming Forum)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ib_FilterFloodFill(java.awt.Image imageToFill)
      Constructor for flood fill, requires the image for filling operation.
      ib_FilterFloodFill(java.awt.Image imageToFill, java.awt.Image maskImage)
      Constructor for flood fill, requires the image and mask for filling operation.

      • fill

        public void fill(int x,
        int y,
        java.awt.Color color)
        Flood fills parts of an image.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to start filling.
        y - The y coordinate to start filling.
        color - The new fill color.

      • fill

        public void fill(int x,
        int y,
        java.awt.Color color,
        java.awt.Color patternColor,
        int patternWidth,
        int patternHeight)
        Fills a bounded area of an image. Uses a chessboard pattern. The width in pixels of the chessboard pattern can be specified.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to start filling.
        y - The y coordinate to start filling.
        color - The new fill color.
        patternColor - The color of the pattern to use.
        patternWidth - The width of the chessboard pattern.
        patternHeight - The height of the chessboard pattern.
